text: [RLEETR REERESEIEIEN G A Normal equations Clicker 20: least squares for square matrices Suppose we have added columns to A so that now it is m X m, a square and nonsingular matrix with a condition number k(A) = 100. Then: @ The least-squares problem is mathematically defined but it has no solution @ The least-squares problem is not defined @ The least-squares is mathematically defined and has a solution but the problem is very ill-conditioned @ The solution Z satisfies ||b — AZ|| = 0 (roundoff errors ignored) @ We can solve the least-squares problem and the value of the residual norm ||b — AZ|| depends on the problem Ascher & Greif (UBC Computer Science) A First Course in Numerical Methods CPSC 302, Fall 2023 27/59
